poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Sin"

Beneath the moon's cruel light,
Ezedi walks, scarred visage hidden,
A marred mask of man's spite.
Innocence and youth, corrosion-ridden,
A phantom pursued in urban nights.
Witnesses silent, frightened, smitten,
If you dare glimpse sin's blight,
Eyes to hell, hearts heaven-bidden.
Find courage; bring justice to light,
Retreat not, till evil is overridden.
